oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Letter from B. F. Collingsworth to his father
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Sgt. B. F. Collinsworth, Co. E, 1st Regt. Ky. Vol. Inf., CSA. wrote to his father in Gadsden, Tenn. Camped opposite Harpers Ferry, Va., his letter provides a detailed look at his daily life. He listed his "messmates," gave a "bona fide description" of one of his dinners, and noted that they lived in shantees build of poles" covered with plank, bark, brush or "nothing but the blue canopy of heaven." He also detailed his guard duty, the guard house, and the detrimental effect of repeated false alarms.
